definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: It seems unfair. Except at the margins, there isn't much we can do about physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 似乎老天不太公平，我们不太能改变自己的长相。

sentences.english: "She is what I would call a fine-looking woman, " I said, after a judicial pause.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个我会称为长相好看的女人。

sentences.english: There are striking resemblances between the twin brothers.
sentences.chinese: 双胞胎的长相有惊人的相似之处。

sentences.english: That is what a p-orbital looks like.
At that moment, a horrible looking man entered the pavillion.
sentences.chinese: 这时，有一个长相很吓人的男人走了过来。

sentences.english: The lion is called the king of animals primarily because of its regal appearance.
sentences.chinese: 狮子被称为万兽之王，主要是因为它威严的长相。

sentences.english: Look, you will know that you are a bag that looks, also can only be used to hold a pen.
sentences.chinese: 瞧你那长相就知道你是一笔袋，也只能用来装笔了。

sentences.english: He remarked how odd it was to see someone who looks and acts like him.
sentences.chinese: 他说，看到有人长相和举止都像自己，觉得怪怪的。

sentences.english: Working is like old-time marriage, obviously you got no happiness, but still you have to live with it.
sentences.chinese: 上班就像旧时代的婚姻，明明不幸福，还得长相厮守。

sentences.english: When people found him, they saw that his looks resembled those of a fox.
sentences.chinese: 当人们发现他时，他们看到他的长相颇似那些狐狸。

sentences.english: Always being together is my greatest happiness.
sentences.chinese: 与你长相厮守，是我最大的幸福。

sentences.english: After a few days, the big egg finally hatched and out came a strange-looking duckling with gray feathers .
sentences.chinese: 几天后，那颗大蛋终于孵出一只长相奇怪的灰毛鸭。

sentences.english: I think that moray eels have a sinister appearance.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得海鳝的长相可怖。

sentences.english: The Lord prefers common-looking people.That is the reason he makes so many of them.
sentences.chinese: 上帝喜欢长相平凡的人，所以他创造了这么多普通人。

sentences.english: The plain woman explained to me why she complained about the chain.
sentences.chinese: 长相平平的女人向我解释她为什么抱怨那条链子。

sentences.english: He is not a good-looking guy, but he’s very funny.
sentences.chinese: 他长相并不好看，但是他很滑稽。

definition: five sense organs of TCM (nose, eyes, lips, tongue, ears 鼻目口舌耳)/facial features
